column1: Dr. Ferdinand Lumban Tobing Airport (Indonesia: Bandar Udara Ferdinand Lumban Tobing) (also known as Pinangsori Airport) (IATA: FLZ
column2: ICAO: WIMS) is an airport serving the city of Sibolga in the North Sumatra province of Indonesia. Ferdinand Lumbantobing (19 February 1899 - 7 October 1962) was Minister of Manpower and Transmigration of the Republic of Indonesia
column3: Minister for Communications and Information of the Republic of Indonesia
column4: Minister of Health of the Republic of Indonesia
column5: and Governor of North Sumatra. With the inauguration of the well equipped and modern terminal on February 2013
column6: the Airport now able to provided better and comfortable environment for its passengers. The operation of the Airport is managed by UPT Ditjen Hubud
column7: an agency under Ministry of Transportation
column8: Indonesia. Flight Destinations There are commercial schedule flights from Ferdinand Lumban Tobing Airport to destinations as below: Airline Name Destination Garuda Indonesia (by Explore) Medan Garuda Indonesia (by Explore Jet) Jakarta–Soekarno–Hatta Susi Air Batu Islands
column10: Simpang Ampek Wings Air Medan Public Transportation Taxi and private car services: Various taxi and private car services are provided by numerous service providers outside the arrival hall. Car Park: There are plenty of vehicle parking space within walk distance outside the terminal. Technical Specification The airport resides at an elevation of 10 metres (33 ft) above mean sea level. It has one runway designated 12/30 with an asphalt surface measuring 2
column12: 415 ft). Address: Pinang Sori Parjalihotan Baru Kabupaten Tapanuli Tengah Sumatera Utara 22654 Indonesia
